post.body: I might have to un-follow @rgj.com cuz the tweets about I-80 keep giving me heart attax. Then I realize it's YOUR I-80...
everything OK at @impromptu studio? when the power went out I saw flashing lites in front of yr bldg...
Yes, it was in my bed. I refuse to be embarrassed by that.
Yes, and you are one. Neener neener neener!
I earned about $35 and they still couldn't offer anything remotely interesting. I quit too.
Them. Cowboys. Are. Instruments. Of. The. Devil.
Hey, u can work that into one of the DM art categories. Sustainably, cooperatively clearing ice & snow in inclusive neighborhoods?
Thanks for the demystifier! They all did seem really dance-y.
We need that here. Where do you get peppermint coffee??
@KellyAnnScott Ohmygod. I caught myself saying "TV Set" recently, and paused, and thought, "Now where did that come from?"
Nice report on the opera singers. Aren't opera people great?
That is the most useful dog training effect ever. You should give lessons.
My dad has one. He moved it in an armature of 2x4s - more cage than box - insulated with industrial-grade styrofoam
Yeah. What you said.
I second that emotion. Did Fox really think Bills vs Jets on CBS would dominate the ratings that much?
Good idea. I love those guys/gals.
I nominate @marscafe for a Shorty Award in #business because... tweets have real content + they luv & cherish their customers
That sounds much better. Because it was YOU, I was actually willing to believe it was some crazy hitchhiking stunt.
You are ... hitchhiking thru Nebraska?? Umm, have .... fun??
Glad I am not the only one delivering a scarf with needle still attached and a few feet to go...
I have an unopened 2 lb bag of K.A. whole wheat ... but that's not the very thing is it?
My new marshmallow shooter comes to work tomorrow. If your dry ice and vodka come too it can be Mildly Dangerous Day in the newsroom
Somewhere between Really Freakin' and Oh My God We're All Going To Die.
one Reno thrift shop everyone forgets about is across from Wooster sorta toward the airport. They might have a few left.
Just dug thru bin at Target to find the last functioning doggie lite-up Santa hat. I now officially have no shame.
Just saw 3 people try the doors of E. Village Books. They were all surprised it is closed.
It's my b-day weekend so I'm gettin the snow tires put on. I know how to party.
For sale this AM at the Register Employees' United Way Booksale - several mint copies of "Lullaby Versions of AC/DC.."
Oh marvelous blackberry, I thought I'd lost you!! Let's never be apart again!
Oh, cool, I got to the 100-followers mark. So ... ya know the one about Jesus & the Chinese food? Think of the punchline and laugh now.
#NYresolutions - stop rudeness to people who can't deal w/ their computers, wear makeup, organize MP3s, get out more. But now, sleep.
Frost/Nixon. I am the target audience for this and I'm probably not going. I wonder who will.
Everytime I am cooking the 'Skins win. So tonite: Beef stew, pumpkin bread.
creative tweeps: Have you seen any cool & unusual make-it-urself family gifts using photos?
A few brave kids trying to sled down the hill across from the Capitol. There isn't really any snow but apparently the grass is icy.
Here's what is wrong with "Meet Me in St.Louis": way too long before it gets to the Halloween Scene. On TCM right now!!
That big electronic billboard at 63rd & Grand has FBI Most Wanted notices on it now.
Charlie Brown Christmas 7 pm on Channel 5.
Man, this is premium grade powder. I miss skiing.
Gahhhh. Forgot my office shoes - now must go without shoes all day, or wear my snow boots.
On a consumer survey about department stores: "Imagine that these stores were to come to life as people..."
Unexpected perk of taking Mon off - "Smokey & the Bandit" on cable. Never seen it till now. So much has been made clear.
Have now seen 3 trend stories about how Twitter is "over" because people my age are using it. How mortifying. And empowering.
Best CD from charity sale: Rufus Wainwright Does Judy at Carnegie Hall. It's the best of that kind of thing, if you like that kind of thing.
Wow. What's all that brouhaha at 31st & Ingersoll? Looks like bikes, beer and Santa Clauses have invaded.
Seasonal reminder: Poinsettias poisonous to pets. Positive point: pooch puked, will be OK.
Looks like the card shop in the Kaleidoscope closed over the weekend. Rocs not Hallmark.
Modern Problems: A device is beeping in my house and I can't figure out which one.
Deeliteful. Awoke to dog-throwing-up sound. If I stay in bed all day I don't have to deal with it, right?
Two countem two cars full of kids driving the wrong way up Third in the Court Ave area. Might be a fun night downtown.
Dear Mother Nature: Really??!! I'm headed in to work to start the weather updates.
Wow, amazing package full of baked delights from @mikejcorey. You all ought to try some but I'm not letting them go.
I figured out the Moms admin! Is this where I get to say FTW?! deserve more treats.
Uh oh. Never heard a peep from neighbors. Now suddenly I can hear every word. There are several dimensions to this, all bad.
Target has put its Valentines Day stuff out.
Did you know... Graziano Bros. has first-rate, super-thin frozen pizza crusts, but only in winter. (Explanation too long for twitter).
1 - try to put booties on mystified dog. 2 - break down in hysterical laughter. 3 - repeat until dog develops permanent neurosis.
